glg2d

Class VertexBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • glg2d.VertexBuffer

  • public class VertexBuffer
extends Object
    Wraps a simple FloatBuffer and makes it easier to push 2-D vertices into the buffer and then draw them using any mode desired. The default constructor uses a global buffer since drawing in OpenGL is not multi-threaded.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VertexBuffer

        protected VertexBuffer(FloatBuffer buffer)

      • VertexBuffer

        public VertexBuffer(int capacity)
        Creates a private buffer. This can be used without fear of clobbering the global buffer. This should only be used if you have a need to create two parallel shapes at the same time.
        Parameters:
        capacity - The size of the buffer in number of vertices

    • Method Detail

      • getSharedBuffer

        public static VertexBuffer getSharedBuffer()
        Creates a buffer that uses the shared global buffer. This is faster than allocating multiple float buffers. Since OpenGL is single-threaded, we can assume this won't be accessed outside the OpenGL thread and typically one object is drawn completely before another one. If this is not true, one of the objects being drawn simultaneously must use a private buffer. See #VertexBuffer(int).

      • addVertex

        public void addVertex(float[] array,
             int offset,
             int numVertices)
        Adds multiple vertices to the buffer.
        Parameters:
        array - The array containing vertices in the form (x,y),(x,y)
        offset - The starting index
        numVertices - The number of vertices, pairs of floats

      • addVertex

        public void addVertex(float x,
             float y)
        Adds a vertex to the buffer.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate
        y - The y coordinate

      • ensureCapacity

        protected void ensureCapacity(int numNewFloats)

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Discard all existing points. This method is not necessary unless the points already added are not needed anymore and the buffer will be reused.

      • getBuffer

        public FloatBuffer getBuffer()

      • drawBuffer

        public void drawBuffer(GL2 gl,
              int mode)
        Draws the vertices and rewinds the buffer to be ready to draw next time.
        Parameters:
        gl - The graphics context to use to draw
        mode - The mode, e.g. GL#GL_LINE_STRIP
